property.name: text
property.value:
Given (n choose 2) measurements from a node set of n nodes, find the least-squares solution for vertex coordinates in 2-D.
The measurement model defines each measurement to be a Gaussian random variable with mean equal to the true distance between nodes and a standard deviation of sigma. n choose 2 The optimization problem we consider is min \sum {e_i} , where e_i = TrueDistance_i - Measurement_i i=1
The current problem considers four nodes named {A,B,C,D} and the pairwise measurements with sigma = 2.0. The plot shows the Minimum least-square coordinates for A,B,C and D nodes. Note that node A is anchored at (0,0) and node B is set to be on the y-axis. There are, therefore, 5 free variables to be optimized: {By, Cx, Cy, Dx, Dy}.

entity.name: Gaussian
entity.doc: Create a sequence of gaussian random variables

entity.name: CompositeOptimizer
entity.doc: Optimize the objective function provided in the inside composite, subject to constraints and precision/iteration limits

svg.text: measurements = [zAB, zAC, zBC, zBD, zAD, zCD]

property.name: _layoutHint
